name: ACP Local Government Platform
goal:
The objectives of the Platform are to:
• Promote the political recognition of local governments as a distinct actors in the ACP-EU cooperation;
• Represent, promote and protect, the interests of ACP local governments within the context of ACP-EU cooperation;
• Be recognised by ACP and EU governments to be the (sole) representative and consultative body in respect of all matters concerning local government within the ACP-EU cooperation framework and to make representations to both the ACP Group and the EU in respect of any matter concerning ACP local government;
• To be the united voice and representative of ACP local government within the ACP-EU cooperation framework.
• Promote and support at the ACP-EU level effective dialogue between (still to be completed);
• Promote integration into ACP-EU cooperation programmes concerns of ACP-LGs;
• Promote twinning and partnerships;
• Promote the mainstreaming of decentralisation policy in ACP-EU cooperation;
• Promote new mechanisms for dialogue and information flow and to this end gather, disseminate and share information on all matters relevant to LG and pursuit of these objectives;
• Strengthen the capacity of ACP local governments for dialogue;
• Establish, improve and strengthen conditions for effective dialogue between the Platform and the European Union;
• Develop a policy framework for cooperation between the ACP-EU and the ACP local governments at regional and national levels;
• Promote the adoption and implementation of policy frameworks.
• Promote the development and maintenance of systems of elected local government in the ACP States where such systems do not currently exist.
• Obtain and disseminate information on matters of importance to local government authorities.
It will seek to achieve these objectives by:
• Dialogue between the partners
• Information dissemination
• Programming, review and implementation of the Cotonou Agreement
• Capacity-building for local governments
